intro: Phalangium urgineoides, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds, typical of the legume family. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in grasslands and open woodlands. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
